definition[0]: a piece of computer software that many want to buy, especially one that works so well on a particular machine that people want to buy it
definition[1]: a very useful or exciting computer program that customers feel they must have
example[0]: An example of a killer app is the spreadsheet program.
definition[2]: a feature of a product’s hardware or software which the manufacturer says is much better than anybody else’s, in an attempt to make people want to buy that product rather than any other one
